definition: to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: Kim was carried out of the ring by stretcher and rushed to Desert Springs Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 随后，金被担架抬出拳击台，送往沙漠甘泉医院。

sentences.english: As soon as he regretfully put down his gun, he fell unconscious and was earried away on a stretcher.
sentences.chinese: 他遗憾地一放下枪，就晕倒了，被人们用担架抬走。

sentences.english: The easiest thing to do is to use heavy-duty stretcher bars.
sentences.chinese: 容易事情要做的是使用重型担架酒吧。

sentences.english: Most of the miners were unable to walk unassisted and some were placed on stretchers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的矿工不能独立行走，还有一些被抬在担架上。

sentences.english: At first he had waved aside the litter-bearers with an angry toss of his head.
sentences.chinese: 起先，他曾生气地摇摇头，让担架员走开。

sentences.english: The patient groaned as he was lifted onto the stretcher.
sentences.chinese: 在把病人抬到担架上时，病人呻吟着。

sentences.english: I saw people taken out and put on stretchers.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有人从房子里救出，然后送上担架。

sentences.english: Then Chen Meng was carried out on a stretcher, rushed to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 随后陈梦被担架抬出场外，送往医院。

sentences.english: Several people were taken away on stretchers.
The guards wrestle Fat-Ass onto a stretcher and carry him off.
sentences.chinese: 守卫们把胖子费力地挪到担架上抬走了。

sentences.english: The injured were carried away on stretchers.
sentences.chinese: 用担架把受伤的人抬走了。

sentences.english: A man on a stretcher begins to breathe heavily.
sentences.chinese: 担架上的一位男士开始呼吸沉重。

sentences.english: At about 4am the girl got onto the ambulance with the stretcher.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨4时，女子跟着担架上了急救车。

sentences.english: Stretcher bars for canvas giclee art reproductions are easy to assemble.
sentences.chinese: 艺术复制品的油画作品画册专辑担架酒吧都容易组装。

sentences.english: Seated on a shimmering litter, Pachacutec issued the order to attack.
sentences.chinese: 帕恰库德坐在一顶闪闪发光的担架上，下令进行攻击。

sentences.english: Soon, the corpse of flower son is put at the load up, have already lifted mountain to go.
sentences.chinese: 不久，花子的尸体被人放在担架上，抬下山去了。

definition: to lend an arm to support sb
variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]
to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)
